benchmark_details.name: Safe-Embed
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces new pairwise datasets and the Categorical Purity (CP) metric to assess the ability of sentence encoders to distinguish between safe and unsafe prompts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically measure the Safety-Critical knowledge of various sentence encoders and improve their capabilities as safety detectors.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The evaluation only considers short, simple prompts written in English; more complex unsafe prompts were not included.

data.source: Newly created pairwise datasets including Safety-Challenging and Safety-Taxonomy datasets.
data.annotation: Manual creation of unsafe prompts to match safe prompts.

methodology.calculation: CP is calculated by measuring the cosine similarity among prompts within the same category.
methodology.interpretation: A higher CP score indicates better categorization of unsafe prompts.
methodology.baseline_results: SBERT-all achieved a CP score of 0.747, ST5-XXL achieved 0.823 for successful categorization.
methodology.validation: Results validated against established datasets like XSTest and Do-Not-Answer.

targeted_risks.harm: This benchmark aims to prevent harmful outputs in LLMs from unsafe prompts.
